headline: New York Plan May Overhaul Property Taxes
abstract: New York City property taxes, long considered inequitable, could face a big overhaul under a plan from a mayoral commission.
lead_paragraph: New York Cityâ€™s antiquated method of calculating property taxes has long allowed owners of multimillion-dollar brownstones in Brooklyn and high-rise co-ops by Central Park to pay less in taxes than working-class homeowners in the South Bronx, relative to the value of their properties.
